page.title: 17 SHOPPING - THE MARKETS
page.content: In central Bury the market complex includes a large outdoor market and an indoor one. The market hall was opened in 1971, replacing the old hall which burnt down in 1968. The main feature is the 'Gull wing' design of the glass roof. It is built on three levels. The basement includes storage space, incinerators & boilers for heating. The ground floor consists of 42 stall tenants, 30 shop tenants, & 7 tenants in the meat & fish hall. All the management offices are on the first floor. The outdoor market is famous over the N.W. it is noted for fruit & veg. and the{Black Pudding Stall}which has been a feature for over 100 years. There is a hand turned-roundabout recently replaced after fire. B.G.S ( Girls ) Prep & Holy Trinity
